title: Grade K
subject: Common Core State Standards for English Language Arts & Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects (2010)

document.title: Common Core State Standards for English Language Arts & Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects

6FC7E9228582417C9F89050A1E0F4395.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

2BB1CFB0A7504369903FBD5CEE6E5C02.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

D77E3A22AAE64D64A6E00967E2FB6ADE.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

42F092F06034496C8537DFE4E1A2ED5F.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

CB64575A714F4FAAA7FDDE0D7F7263B6.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

86693EC229B84DFD94E937EC02AB2BD1.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

C46464D3756947A7A138A0EA7EA775BB.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

B5D163E32D194A3E9A1ABDAF1E661A5B.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

F149FA5755914BD4BD7ABB653FA0A6AA.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

2602D6B96BB64AE4807DA2B6B41EA3F6.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

E869F8260F694B6EB95482606461E953.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

D00FAFFB524E4E73AAD366CBEA8CA235.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

E5D3F53E45D546599498BC99884DAEE8.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

91AA8F58E0CD4936947143EBF9F179B6.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

C837D97D1DBD4FA5A445A6A071C3CE6B.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

8FB8974AF0B14AE28515DAEA53C270F9.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

AF20B1C215004C08B3A157B928A147B1.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

4EB8D7743CB646EEA81E4A447722F8DF.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

5DA370C18D494F209BC03C8D2C6DECAB.description: Print many upper- and lowercase letters.

116495D01468450C825DBCDB8B7CD8F4.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

E849A05842B84D768E44107594DDE596.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

BDC58EFB9F6541DB9191089B85EC1758.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

B7284E8545B44ACA95A998393A26C925.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

5108639371BA4311A6DD7E96E5967950.description: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

1ECBACF8C9824BCCBB9AAF720BC7CE57.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

A00E058E554F49DF981F6C9CB445C820.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

6A5FEB6404104C7B8C03BB5D3858922A.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

2635458C94AF4C2496011E0375304360.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

429BBF40088849D1B3E501A80DDB878A.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

573AFAE455C14533AD8CB366C3AAE703.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

E06675B43AF748B683EFA17A9C6292F9.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

1F40C0FBA11744A0AE98C1170FE06BCE.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

4481CC48BF144044AF9D7B6C1E15EEEF.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

D48304AFE2CA4B9BB92EFB6C7D7CA258.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

FF405173EDBF4011A2563D74ECB2B461.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

8C613E136DFF440DA24238A7CDC8B2F3.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

690E64311D45444EBCC760D0A066BE66.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

B9E0F18D417941A686842CD8DD3210FA.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

35EFFFCE3D5B40E69B74BC34E79D2386.description: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

06205884C32943ECA22C087C58A24490.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

2A454B8DC3F348869A791E20A4EAF229.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

F441A860553044B5BA29E6CE5F4BBC8C.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

310064E59AF04965A4676223916C82C2.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

BD3B6E68DBAE4A17941DD403573D8D4A.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

02D5DA259652479EB712AE49AC44C616.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

F834DBD616144EB58CF12D7F49B632D2.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

FB43B61237AE40D19D715A8D2A38A88D.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

025C033B965F41A39E448BA3865CDEDB.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

F7176FD711134427921CAF19B95EF5E1.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

37B096D58ACD4A54881EA3C2AF53424C.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book is…).

FB11DFF8A02E42348856223C4610FD7B.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

E728991B5E74444A9D74EF882EA6EA08.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

5A9D39BC9F6448F4821190FE958FCA3F.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

59A02A4B3CB0458E90DD509BC112DDA8.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

E96AFF81A1004933A42CB4A2B77ED590.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

99DF344D0BF04BFBBA899EB26AD9750D.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

0A4861981DB740E4B611858CEEC23DD3.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

E1A0C18E7E2541B199FF7E173CEC2464.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

0AC7BB79B6BF4916AD55641BBC3DA2C7.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

09AEDE725003451E8B2D25608928B70A.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

7F3EA7F259A846C3A930DC494112AC28.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

ACC935C39ABE45C2AD5FF69301BF1020.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

DCEE58F763E940A8AEA126A041510CDC.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

C9075CF8D52A490B9BDA7D43AAC7B63A.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

202E9C3EB2D64F89BF16572086B52301.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

80B51BF6B0924E6A98F40315A46B4546.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

8E011D5EC8874E6A8B2559DFC117E723.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary or many of the most frequent sound for each consonant.

FFDC4C521C5E482EB85C4000CB20AE84.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

594BED98154E461B81B8E688F161B754.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

7D1A57A53D35494788939E7A259BEAFF.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonent-vowel-consonent, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

721FCA7A1C374F119B104D5DE9BEBC1C.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

4E551F34D4E945DF9C54755AE17DDB5E.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

F7ADFFF1200849A298D96F0F5EEC7312.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

D47BFC0C327448518D195F2A5141449F.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

6F9F5755ED63482E987D046E3961075E.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

0213191B0D2C486F88DCA79F3C9375E9.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

6674167E3A5647D1A8B3FFDF9A288948.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

2D2E89BC97BF425D927098C186843E5E.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

6F19084186794AC0AEE0B5079668C0F9.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

537388178A7F45C48F95E31DEEF0FAD6.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

518CE1DF3BB640B6826DD1BB3B8C7D9D.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

23F0B9040A5C4AB2806BF27BEA2053C0.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

B082B8763386443AB044364223339F3E.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

574EE6DF9B9346F1BC43ABD6EE6C8472.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

4F480C038B0E480EBB884CD243BC6A2E.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

A2AC1251DD534F8699682DD40277E8BC.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

6129C917CAA440E9B195384CB92A79E3.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

1D8F61F0D0B34619A578CD33E6348683.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

0B42E87558174739A6E67EF9AB0C7ED6.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

8F5555D3B1694B4999E05B7EE4AD0A7C.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

F2896F96F5CA43DD8E05B8816FBC4D98.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

4F388B73701B42E69F61912201A05B19.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

1E53B6AFACF748B09B1D242ED292FE69.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

3D4EF77B5A134FA9B2C1AB6F027CAF1A.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

472DA7B94A3548818F851F6F9885B5CA.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

CB8FDCA67672479F90C68B567E33918E.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

F6422B41430E43088F1590AB4E421384.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

4DAE032BBFB3407D99674CFF92246E9C.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

E2C49F9BEDBF4CFF9A1F5A4D36FEC539.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

16B274AD11A447C1971BC6E5B8DC2830.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

97B9A3A0B6194FDFB6EFA6B9D8BE3FD3.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

BCC0659324ED4504AEE4BAB17DC87DA6.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

9E4820861AA444269A48A0055EF11AFE.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

C19D9B7A39DF4C1DBD6BDE8E30BB6A71.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

2F534109657F42729869546E98F7EC1A.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

137AA7704C3B4B3E938C5A170BEA858A.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

E55F1403826C411D92B1C08BBCF582C0.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

6865900DE4544B8694F93970D6ACFFD1.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

1D2AE639F546472FA6C1E4713BD4FE00.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

74C386F2EB4B4C06BA8245CEE1A1877B.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

2D2CFD257BFF4068902EA51D9B7CA0EB.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
